Case reference: 2017056566.CaseDesc: Darryl Gundrum was last seen between March 1 and September 30, 1970, near Sherwood Park, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2020014650.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1919, at approximately 5:30pm, Ambrose Small was seen for the last time with his lawyer in his office at the Grand Opera House in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, Dark colour with velvet collar

Case reference: 2015027786.CaseDesc: On May, 28, 2015, Jessica Heppner was reported missing by a friend and travelling companion. Jessica was visiting St. John's Newfoundland and was staying at the Sheraton Hotel. She was known to utilize Taxi Cabs as a mode of transportation. She never returned to the hotel to get her belongings.

Case reference: 2013000141.CaseDesc: Brandyn Dirienzo was last seen on the evening of October 4, 2006, entering an apartment building in Chilliwack, B.C. Brandyn was living a high risk lifestyle and foul play is heavily suspected. The police investigation into the disappearance of Brandyn is focussed on identifying those who have directly caused Brandyn's disappearance and/or death.  Investigators are looking for any information from anyone who has knowledge on the whereabouts of Brandyn. Brandyn is the father of two young children and his family is deeply affected by his disappearance.

Teeth: Crooked, Current photos seem to indicate a possible broken, upper right, front tooth
Jacket: Cotton, Black, Hooded Sweatshirt with "G-Unit" logo

Case reference: 2014001361.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2000, Emmanuel Emond was reported missing in Clair, New Brunswick. Emmanuel was last seen by his family on November 28, 1996. Emmanuel is believed to have gone to Mexico at a certain point.

Scar: Cheek, Scar between nose and mouth
Tattoo: Left Hand, X on top of left hand

Case reference: 2014003833.CaseDesc: On September 27, 1975, Barry Kelly was seen for the last time at the Speak-Easy Steakhouse in Niagara Falls, New York, in the United States. He never returned to his Niagara Falls, Ontario, home. At the time of his disappearance, Barry was despondent, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Chain, Around neck
Sweater: Orange, Brown, Hooded, Hooded with stripes

Case reference: 2010000499.CaseDesc: David Kruger was running a business with another individual, and was experiencing financial difficulties. On April 26, 1979, Mr. Kruger was last seen by his business partner, who reported him missing on May 2, 1979. He has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Kruger's mother had died approximately 3 weeks prior, so it is possible he may have been depressed. He was last seen at his residence in Guelph, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010004199.CaseDesc: Kalon Purvis had been living and working in the Minden area since early May 2008.  He had been involved in a car accident on June 19, 2008 resulting in him needing to use a rental car.  The small red rental car was returned sometime in July.  Mr. Purvis was last seen in July 2008 when he was dropped off in the area of the Home Hardware store in Minden to meet someone he was going to do some work for, for two weeks.  Mr. Purvis would have had a large male dog (Rottweiler) named Magnum with him around the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Black, Wavy, Medium length and parted in the middle
Tattoo: Abdomen, Incomplete graphic of horse heads

Case reference: 2013000108.CaseDesc: Roger Houle is missing from Montreal since July 12, 1996. Roger is hearing impaired and mute. He left his home without taking anything. He worked for 15 years at the same place and he never advised his employer that he would not be returning to work.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014003011.CaseDesc: In June 1980, William Dailey, an American citizen, left his home in New York State and traveled to Alaska with two friends. William was last seen in July 1980, in the Yukon on the return trip from Alaska. The men had been travelling in a 1972 Dodge dark blue flatbed pick-up truck with racks.

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2021013057.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2020, an abandoned vehicle belonging to Jerry Zawacki was located in the parking lot of 332 Prospect Point in Niagara Falls, New York. New York State Police investigators obtained surveillance video which captured Jerry looking over a railing, near the brink of the Falls, and walking towards the direction of the pedestrian bridge.

Case reference: 2006028199.CaseDesc: Barbara Sadowski and her husband lived a reclusive lifestyle on Marten Lake, in the Marten River area. She was last seen on the 23 or 24 of June 2006, walking along the beach near her home on Marten Lake.  She was recently in poor health.  She walked at a very slow pace, often using one or two canes or walking sticks.

Hair: Grey, White, Long, Often one or two braids
Teeth: Visible Missing, Poor condition, no teeth, mouth appears sunken
Glasses: Brown, Large frame, older style, thick lenses

Case reference: 2019081392.CaseDesc: Casey Badger was last seen leaving his home in Edmonton, Alberta, on January 28, 2020. He was travelling on foot and wrapped in a blanket.

Scar: Right Forearm, Multiple scars on right forearm
Tattoo: Left Chest, Psalms 23 on left chest
Left Cheek, Cross on left cheek

Case reference: 2016044292.CaseDesc: Chenel Dubé was last seen on August 10, 1970 in Montreal, Quebec. That evening, he called his mother to tell her that he would be home later. Chenel's vehicle was found 3 days later in the parking lot of a restaurant in Ville Saint-Laurent, Quebec.

Case reference: 2018020022.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1968, Jacqueline Lefebvre was last seen while she was at the family cottage in Mascouche, Quebec.

Case reference: 2021014455.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2018, Sonya Manning was seen for the last time in Buffalo, New York State. Sonya’s vehicle was located in close proximity to the falls in Niagara Falls. During the time of her disappearance, she was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Right Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Forehead, Turquoise jagged edges at hairline

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2008008099.CaseDesc: Ronald Wallin was canoeing in Upper Manitou Lake located south of Dryden.  Mr. Wallin suffered from what appeared to be a seizure and fell into the water disappering beneath the boat. The area was searched, but Mr. Wallin was not found.

Case reference: 2020017934.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Lebohang Nicol was seen for the last time in the area of 600 University Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Lebohang is also known to go by the first name of “Toby.” He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2007005499.CaseDesc: Lindsey Nicholls was 14 years old when she disappeared in 1993. She left the group home where she was living in the Comox Valley, BC at about 10:30 a.m. after having an argument with her foster mother. She was last seen walking away from the residence to visit some friends in Courtenay. She left all of her belongings and treasures in her room; she did not seem to be planning to run away.

Case reference: 2023056488.CaseDesc: On September 11, 2023, Michael Thomas was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta.  Michael was believed to have gone to the Whyte Avenue area of Edmonton.

Tattoo: Neck, Barbwire with a large "Z" on the front
Left Hand, Small "M" near thumb on back of hand

Case reference: 2014002566.CaseDesc: On May 1985, Sheryl Lyn Donahue was seen for last time in Victoria, British Columbia. There were some indications she may have travelled to Vancouver, Alberta or Toronto.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2010000599.CaseDesc: Bradley Allan Taylor was on his way home to Enfield, Nova Scotia from London, Ontario. He spent the night in Brockville, Ontario at the Travelodge Motel.  On January 10, 2009, he left the motel in the morning and later that day police found his car abandoned near a railway crossing in Roussillon, Quebec. Many of his personal belongings were found in the car. Police searched the area but Mr. Taylor was not located.

Hair: Brown, Long, Straight, Beard, Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2014004253.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2000, two boats were on the Churchill River headed to Granville Lake. One of the boats began taking on water and experiencing motor problems. Most of the occupants of the disabled boat boarded another boat. Mr. Linklater however stayed on the disabled boat attempting to start it. The missing boat was located the next day, however Mr. Linklater was not aboard. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2008003399.CaseDesc: William Smith was last seen operating a large boat leaving Port Rowan, Ontario at approximately 5:30 pm on June 23, 1983. The boat was seen heading out to the north channel, which would lead into Lake Erie. The boat is described as a white, 31 foot, 1977 Bertram hardtop cruiser with a flying bridge. The hull VIN number is 3121641B and the boat had twin Mercruiser 330 hp engines.

Case reference: 2014001533.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1988, Alojz Bracek was on a hunting trip in the Tony Tower area near Fox Creek, Alberta, with two hunting partners and went missing when he was separated from them.

Case reference: 2014005526.CaseDesc: Angela Meyer went missing from her parents’ residence. She was on a weekend pass from Stanton Territorial Hospital and under the legal guardianship of her mother. Miss Meyer had gone outside of the residence for a cigarette and has not been seen since. There were sightings of her walking in the Con Mine area.  She was taking various medications and did not take the medications with her when she went missing.

Jacket: Nylon, Red, Black, Hip length, black on the back of sleeves

Case reference: 2013000042.CaseDesc: On August 8, 1999, Mary Smith was seen for the last time as she checked herself out of the Selkirk Mental Health Centre in Selkirk, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Mary had received medical treatment, for head injuries, at the Health Sciences Center in Winnipeg. It is out of character for Mary, a mother of four, to not contact her family.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Flower- orchid or poinsettia

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2016, Hellen Ermias and her daughter, Lina Tedros, were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. All of their personal belongings were left behind in their apartment.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020097.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1986, Corrine Moosomin was last seen at approximately 4:00 a.m. on the Saulteaux First Nation near North Battleford, Saskatchewan. She was last seen walking on a grid road. Corrine was reported missing and extensive searches failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2016061229.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1973, a male individual was found on the GO Train tracks near Roncesvalles and the Gardiner, beneath the Sunnyside Walkway, from which he apparently fell/jumped. His post-mortem length was 5’5"-5’8", but due to extensive bone fractures this may not accurately reflect his height. His appendix was not present.

Hair: Short, Straight, Dark, straight hair approximately 2-3" in length
Shirt: Grey, Patterned, may have been blue and white

Case reference: 2012020647.CaseDesc:
Ricky Riopel was reported missing in August 2010 by family members who had not seen or heard from him since December 2008. It was later established that he had been in Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan at a health care facility in October 2009.  
 
The last confirmed sighting of Ricky was in Saskatoon, at a downtown shopping mall, in September 2010. His parents are both failing in health which has prompted this additional request for public assistance.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing top front tooth

Case reference: 2021032527.CaseDesc: The last time Robert Martin was heard from or seen was in the late 1960s. He was last observed working as a miner in the North West Territories. Police had unsuccessfully performed searches for birth and death data. Robert's current whereabouts are unknown.

Mark: Abdomen, Birthmark, white patch of skin around the belly button
Forehead, Birthmark, white patch of skin, white hair hairline

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2014004796.CaseDesc: Shirley Lee Cletheroe was last seen on June 9, 2006 in the Fort St. John area. She has had no contact with her friends or family since that date.

Case reference: 2011762660.CaseDesc: Brittany Stalman was last seen on Crawford Drive, Delta, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2008005099.CaseDesc: On January 26, 1976, Robert McDonald’s employer advised that he had not shown up for work and had not been seen since January 16, 1976. On January 28, 1976 it was reported that Mr. McDonald was seen hitchhiking south out of Ear Falls on Highway 105. Mr. McDonald has not been seen since. He was 33 years old at the time of his disappearance and was last seen at Griffith Mines, north of Ear Falls, ON.

Jacket: Blue, White, skidoo with white stripes

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 1986087920.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1985, Nicole Morin was seen for the last time leaving her apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Nicole had made arrangements to meet her friend in the lobby of their building so they could go swimming in the pool located at the rear of the building. Nicole never appeared in the lobby. Despite an intense search at the time, Nicole has not been found.

Mark: Forehead, Small birthmark on upper right side of forehead

Case reference: 2006004399.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1970, Eldie Martin Sylvester attended the docks at Cedar Point, Georgian Bay, Ontario to await the "scoot" to Christian Island.  Witnesses believe that he may have left on foot to walk home to Christian Island across the ice. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003840.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1986, a male was seen floating in the river. The male initially responded to police calls however shortly after he was observed going under the water. It is presumed he drowned. The identity of the male was unknown to police until Roderick Cook's parents contacted police advising they had not seen their son for some time. It is assumed the man in the river was Roderick based both on the description and the fact that he was seen walking near the river. Police further found footprints that led from the shore to the open water. No foul play is suspected in this matter and it is assumed Mr. Cook drowned.

Teeth: Two front upper teeth are false

Case reference: 2020008698.CaseDesc: On December 13, 1969, Helen Booth was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Helen had gone out with her boyfriend and he thought she was going to go home with a friend at 11:30pm.

Case reference: 2020040389.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1947, Rosella DeLong was seen for the last time leaving her family home in Toronto, Ontario. Rosella intended on travelling to the USA to take a course and to buy equipment to start a weight loss clinic.

Case reference: 2012020002.CaseDesc: Perry Sebastian was last seen December 26, 2011. Perry is from the Hagwilget First Nations reserve and reported missing from the Southbank area of Burns Lake, British Columbia. He was reportedly despondent.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2005005799.CaseDesc: October 8, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found floating in Hamilton Bay near the Skyway Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140-150 lbs and his length was measured at 5'4"-5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is thought to have been in the water for months to years.

Teeth: His upper right central incisor has a silicate/resin restoration.

Case reference: 2014004758.CaseDesc: Brent Bassett was last seen in December 1987 and was living on his boat that had no engine at West Bay Marina in Esquimalt, British Columbia. Mr. Bassett struggled with cognitive issues and was known to be friendly and trusting. Mr. Bassett  collected bottles from other people in the Marina for spending money and worked at the Salvation Army Thrift Store.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2017061282.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1999, Andrew Fraser was seen for the last time near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003613.CaseDesc: Larry Mattis was last seen on March 10, 1983 when he was taken to the Edmonton, Alberta airport by a friend and dropped off for a flight to Toronto, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Larry was living a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2006003699.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2002, a male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Don River, north of the Queen Street East Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 217 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Full gold crown lower right first molar, a dental implant replacing upper right central incisor, multiple amalgam restorations.
Shirt: Red, T-shirt with indistinguishable white lettering

Case reference: 2006022699.CaseDesc: Nick Hibbart was prospecting when he was last seen by police at his camp on Gravel River on June 8, 1988. Police returned to the area on July 25, 1988, and found that the camp was burned to the ground. There was no sign of Mr. Hibbart and investigations have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2012020110.CaseDesc: On September 23 2000, Nathalie Godbout was seen for the last time in the Saint-Romuald district in Lévis, Quebec. Nathalie was the mother of two children.

Case reference: 2014005439.CaseDesc: John Sparrow was last seen in April or May of 2001, getting into an early 1990s black Chevrolet pick-up truck while accompanied by an unknown male driver. Mr. Sparrow and the unknown man left the parking lot of the Denny's restaurant located at Benson Ave and Division St, in the city of Kingston, Ontario and headed north past highway #401.

Case reference: 2021047301.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2001, Margarito Perez-Hernandez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019040401.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1975, this approximately 60 year old man collapsed on East Hastings Street in Burnaby, British-Columbia. He had a bruise on the left side of his head and had recently undergone cranial surgery due to a head injury.

Case reference: 2014002145.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1975, Mr. Garson with his father, brother and a friend set out for Moose Lake to hunt. On September 14, other hunters found gas cans, and a thermos with the name of Garson on it. These hunters reported their findings to police.  A search was initiated and police found a boat submerged upright on the bottom of the lake. The depth of the lake around the boat was only 8 to 10 feet deep. It appeared to Police that the men encountered extremely rough water while crossing Moose Lake. The motors were both found to be in forward gear. There was no floatation gear in the boat and it was heavily loaded with camping and hunting equipment. All of the bodies were recovered with the exception of M. Garson. It is presumed Mr. Garson drowned.

Case reference: 2018045881.CaseDesc: In July of 2018 Tatianna Cuevas was taken on vacation by her father John Varga from Toronto, Ontario to Paris, France. It is the belief that she was abducted by her father as they have not returned to Canada on the agreed upon date.

Case reference: 2023062205.CaseDesc: Kevin HIPFNER was seen for the last time on November 10, 2023, in rural Barrhead, Alberta. Kevin left home driving his father's vehicle.  The vehicle was located near a lake, to date Kevin has not been located.

Case reference: 2012020135.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1988, Melanie Temperton was reported missing. Melanie left her residence located in Mascouche, Quebec around 9:00 pm to go to Montreal, Quebec where she met friends in different places. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2010006399.CaseDesc: Glen Wesley, a patient at the Northeast Mental Health Hospital, was granted permission to leave the facility on his birthday. Staff believe he went to downtown North Bay. Mr. Wesley did not return and was noticed missing at approximately 2:15 PM. He suffers from Schizophrenia which requires medication. Since his disappearance there have been several unconfirmed sightings of Mr. Wesley in the Cochrane, Timmins and New Liskeard areas.

Case reference: 2006025299.CaseDesc: Eetu Vainonen has been missing from the Thunder Bay (Port Arthur) area since sometime during 1935 to 1936.

Case reference: 2006019099.CaseDesc: Janet Derbyshire was last seen on December 4, 1976, in St. Joseph Island near Sault Ste. Marie, ON.  She was  seen jumping off the St. Joseph's Island Bridge into the  water. She was seen floating downstream for approximately .25 miles before she submerged under water. Janet Derbyshire is presumed drowned but her body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2021000934.CaseDesc: On January 25, 2002, Vincent Lamouris was seen for the last time near the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Vincent was despondent.

Shoes: Black, Dress shoes; brand: Mephisto; with a buckle on the side
Sweater: Wool, Black, Long sleeves; Ralph Lauren logo on the chest
Watch: White, Wrist watch; brand: Rodania; with a black leather strap

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2014005807.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2012, Marc St-Laurent was seen for the last time on a bench outside the grocery store at Place Quévillon in Lebel-sur-Quévillon, Quebec. His pick-up, a white 1992 GMC Sierra, was located on 26 July 2012, in a federated snowmobile trail, approximately three kilometres from Lebel-sur-Quévillon.

Case reference: 2014035917.CaseDesc: On October 14, 2014, Steven Hector Gravel was reported missing from North Bay, Ontario by his mother. Family members and friends have not seen nor heard from him since December 2000.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tattoo of a baby
Right Upper Arm, Stephanie, Lucky, winnie the pooh
Right Upper Arm, Heart, wings, sword

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2023033146.CaseDesc: Winston Seeseequon was last seen June 24, 2023, in the community of South Tallcree First Nation in Alberta.  Winston's clothes were located by the river.  Extensive searches of land, water and air proved negative.

Case reference: 2006015699.CaseDesc: Troy Edgell was last seen on June 4, 2000, in Cornwall, Ontario, driving a maroon 1987, Lincoln. On June 5, 2000, the Lincoln was located, burned out in the Lanark Highlands, northwest of Perth, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000016.CaseDesc: Marjorie Ferris was reported missing when she did not show up in London, Ontario, where she was to visit friends. Her apartment was found secured and intact with her purse inside. Her vehicle was parked in the underground garage at her building. Extensive investigation failed to uncover any information regarding her disappearance.

Teeth: False, Full upper and lower dentures

Case reference: 2012020090.CaseDesc: In 1993, a human foot and running shoe were located along the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, SK, approximately 1 km west of the river forks. The foot was examined by the University of Saskatchewan Department of Archaeology. It was determined to be that of a robust male, size 10, big boned, and athletic, likely between the ages of 30 and 60.

Case reference: 2024016877.CaseDesc: Nakita Harris, also known by her middle name "Jade," was last seen on October 2, 2023, in Regina, Saskatchewan. Her family and friends have not heard from her since November 2023. There is no evidence to suggest Nakita is the victim of foul play, however, the authorities and her family want to locate her to ensure her safety.

Case reference: 2016068405.CaseDesc: On March 29, 1970, the remains of a male were found on the Lake Erie shore in Point Pelee National Park. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 1 week to 6 months prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2016003652.CaseDesc: Shelley Desrochers was last seen on January 2, 2016 in London (ON). Police and family are concerned for her well being.

Other:
Cell Phone, Lost cell phone 
BLACK ZTE GRAND X2 Z850
S# 867239025096526 & SS 326E52104380
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Rose, Heart & blue bird

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2023025594.CaseDesc: On September 17, 2010, Tiamanja Palazzo was last observed in close proximity to the American Falls, in Niagara Falls, New York, USA. Tiamanja was subsequently reported missing by her family a short time later. Tiamanja was despondent at the time of her disappearance.

Foreign Object: Middle Back, Steel rod in back
Tattoo: Right Leg, Mermaid - blue and red

Case reference: 2014004849.CaseDesc: In the evening of November 21, 2006, Yves Castonguay left his residence in Bécancour, Gentilly sector. He may have been spotted a few times; however Mr. Castonguay has had no contact with his family since this date. His family have reason to fear for his health and safety.

Case reference: 2014005505.CaseDesc: Forrest Schab was last seen on August 13th 2010 in Mexico City, Mexico.

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976

Case reference: 2018062675.CaseDesc: On November 3, 2018, Aaron Normandeau was seen for the last time by a friend on the Ottawa River in an aluminum boat. The boat capsized and Aaron went under the water and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2012020082.CaseDesc: Katelyn Noble was last seen in the Radisson, SK district in mid August, 2007. Katelyn has had no contact with her family or friends in Mission, BC, and her whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2013000024.CaseDesc: Susan Dawson was living with, and working for, Terry Murphy for approximately 3 weeks prior to her disappearance. She was last seen in the late hours of November 12, 1985 at a gathering at Terry's house. On November 13, a blue car was seen in Terry's yard. On November 14, at approximately 11:55 a.m., a massive explosion occurred at Terry's residence. Terry's remains were found in the debris but there was no indication that Susan was in the house at the time of the explosion. Investigators suspect foul play, and that Terry had some involvement with Susan's disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002023.CaseDesc: Lara Brown was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in September 1998.  Lara was last heard from by a friend at the end of August 1998.

Case reference: 2023036470.CaseDesc: Ryan Liu was last seen by his brother on July 9, 2023 as he left the family residence in Richmond, British Columbia.  On the same night, Ryan was also captured on video in West Vancouver, British Columbia.  Ryan has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Cream, Ivory, T Shirt, Large logo on the front

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2010004099.CaseDesc: Timmy Villemaire was last seen by his family in the Cambridge area sometime in 2001. At the time of his disappearance, he was showing signs that he may have been suffering from schizophrenia. He was queried by a Waterloo Regional police officer in Cambridge on June 1, 2002. Normal checks on his health card, SIN card and more cards have shown no activity since the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Brown, Short, Curly, Beard, moustache, sideburns

Case reference: 2014005513.CaseDesc: Jayson Nakas was reported missing on June 30, 1995 to the RCMP in Drayton Valley, Alberta. Mr. Nakas fell off an inner tube on the North Saskatchewan River. Mr. Nakas' friends saw him go under water but did not see him come back up.  His friends were the last ones to see him that day.
